title: 2 Simple Ways to Make Photos Private on Facebook

steps.title: Open the Facebook app.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app. This looks like a white f with a blue background. If you aren't already logged in , enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now. Facebook is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store .

steps.title: Navigate to your profile.
steps.content: Navigate to your profile. Tap ☰ in the bottom-right (iPhone) or top-right (Android), and then tap your name. [1] X Research source On iPads, you can tap your profile picture at the top.

steps.title: Tap Photos.
steps.content: Tap Photos . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Tap Albums.
steps.content: Tap Albums . If you want to change the privacy settings for a single photo, tap Uploads instead.

steps.title: Select an album.
steps.content: Select an album. If you're changing the privacy settings for a single photo, tap a photo. Make sure that your selected photo is one that you uploaded, not just one in which you're tagged . You can't adjust the privacy options for photos that aren't yours.

steps.title: Tap ••• in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap ••• in the top-right corner. This will open a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Tap Edit album.
steps.content: Tap Edit album . A new page will open. If you're changing the privacy settings for a single photo, tap Edit post audience instead.

steps.title: Select the current privacy setting.
steps.content: Select the current privacy setting. This may be set to Friends or Public .

steps.title: Select Only Me.
steps.content: Select Only Me . With this privacy setting, only you will be able to view the album or photo.

steps.title: Tap Done, and then Save.
steps.content: Tap Done , and then Save . Your new privacy settings will be saved.

steps.title: Change who can see your tagged photos (optional).
steps.content: Change who can see your tagged photos (optional). If you don't want other users to see the posts you've been tagged in, do the following: Tap ☰ . Tap Settings & Privacy and then Settings . Tap Profile and Tagging . Tap Who can see posts you're tagged in on your profile? Set the audience as Only Me .

steps.title: Go to https://www.facebook.com in your web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://www.facebook.com in your web browser. This will open your Facebook Feed if you're already logged in. [2] X Research source If you aren't logged in, enter your email address (or phone number) and password, then click Log in .

steps.title: Navigate to your profile.
steps.content: Navigate to your profile . Click your profile picture in the top-right corner, and then click your name.

steps.title: Click Photos.
steps.content: Click Photos . You may need to scroll down to find this option.

steps.title: Click Albums.
steps.content: Click Albums . If you want to change the privacy settings for a single photo, click Your Photos instead.

steps.title: Select an album.
steps.content: Select an album. If you're changing the privacy settings for a single photo, click on a photo. Make sure that your selected photo is one that you uploaded, not just one in which you're tagged. You can't adjust the privacy options for photos that aren't yours.

steps.title: Click ••• in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click ••• in the top-right corner. This will open a pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Edit album.
steps.content: Click Edit album . A new page will open. If you're changing the privacy settings for a single photo, click Edit post audience instead.

steps.title: Select the current privacy setting.
steps.content: Select the current privacy setting. This may be set to Friends or Public .

steps.title: Select Only Me.
steps.content: Select Only Me . With this privacy setting, only you will be able to view the album or photo.

steps.title: Click Save.
steps.content: Click Save . Your new privacy settings will be saved.

steps.title: Change who can see your tagged photos (optional).
steps.content: Change who can see your tagged photos (optional). If you don't want other users to see the posts you've been tagged in, do the following: Click your profile picture in the top-right corner. Click Settings & privacy and then Settings . Click Profile and Tagging in the left column. Click Edit next to Who can see posts you're tagged in on your profile? Set the audience as Only Me .
